timeline.content:
Dear Mr. Aniranan

Thank you for calling despite you are busy.

My desired conditions for UCL accommodation are as follows.

1. Close to UCL. If possible, within 10 to 15min on foot from the accommodation to UCL
2. Catered
3. Single room
4. £200-300 or around 300 per week with meal
(5. With private shower/toilet room, if possible)

In view of these, I would like apply for following UCL accommodation, for instance.

1. International Hall
2. Ramsey Hall
3. College Hall
etc.

Are there any vacancies in those accommodations?

I really appreciate your helping.

Sincerely,
Nobuyo Yamamoto

timeline.content: Hi. I’m sorry for my late reply. I am in summer holiday now, so I couldn’t reply the message immediately. As I mentioned previously, I intended to look for an appropriate accommodation for my university during stay at your introduced accommodation. But, it is fortunate that I was able to find an ideal accommodation at the moment. Therefore, I ended up staying there. Thank you very much for your understanding.

transcripts.transcript_text:
Speaker A: Hello?
Speaker B: Hello. Hi, I'm.
Speaker A: Yes I am.
Speaker B: Okay. Hi, I'm calling from Amber Student. I'm calling regarding student accommodation in London.
Speaker A: Okay, thank you. Yes.
Speaker B: Yeah, you are looking for university accommodations near ucl, right? We are actually the university accommodation partners.
Speaker A: Yes.
Speaker B: Okay. And you had a query on our website that you wanted to know about Chapter Kings Cross London, right?
Speaker A: Could you say that again?
Speaker B: You are looking for a property called Chapter Kings Cross in London, right? You had a query about the property?
Speaker A: Ah yes, yes, yes. So I sent email maybe yesterday about Chapter Kings Cross London. Yes, yes.
Speaker B: So yeah, what was the doubt like? What do you want to know about the property?
Speaker A: Sorry, just second. Yeah, so thank you so much for replying my inquiries. So I received the email that Chattah Kings course, so and talk. So maybe I.
Speaker B: So you wanted to know about the cancellation policy, right?
Speaker A: So yes, yes. So maybe this, this recommendation is automated recommendation that you feel. Right, so.
Speaker B: Sorry.
Speaker A: Hello? Hello. So Chapter King's Coast London is the alternative accommodation at ucl. Is this understanding is light?
Speaker B: Yes, not only for UCL students but like other university students are also seeing this.
Speaker A: So I want to ask you about. So if. So if I book, is it able to book and reserve keep this accommodation before paying some fees?
Speaker B: Before paying you want to. Sorry, I didn't get you like I did get your question. You're asking before paying, what do you want to know about the property?
Speaker A: So is it able to keep and disturb Chata Kings Cross London before paying some fees?
Speaker B: You want to see the property before you pay. Sorry, you want to see the property before you pay.
Speaker A: So this means that you know in this timing many many students want to disturb alternative accommodation. So I also. So I am in the process. So I will proceed the process of visa. But before application of visa so I need to find my accommodation of student as possible. So I want to disturb once Cheptackings Coast London as insurance. So not paying completely, but I want to keep some accommodations as insurance for keeping my house and accommodation. So is it able to keep it before paying some fees? This is my inquiry.
Speaker B: Okay, understood, got it, Got your point. Okay, so yes, so you're waiting for your visa right now.
Speaker A: Yes, but I never received CAS from ucl. So after I started saving cash from UCL this week, so I will proceed applying for visa. But before application of visa so I need to keep my accommodation. So I have to do as soon as possible.
Speaker B: Yeah, got it, got it, yeah. So to book the property you have to pay £185 holding fee.
Speaker A: 100 150. £150 pound is 185.
Speaker B: 185. Yes.
Speaker A: £185 pound is keeping fee.
Speaker B: Yes. And it works.
Speaker A: Okay. Okay. So. So this fee is different from. Different from Chapter King's Close London accommodation fees, right?
Speaker B: No, no, no. This is fee you will be paying to the property. This will be deducted from your total rent.
Speaker A: So this fee is includes, includes the website fees. So accommodation fees.
Speaker B: Yes.
Speaker A: Okay. And also I am, I will be a student of UPC student as financial course. So you know, I received a formal offer letter at UCL in 9th of July. So this is over since the deadline of application at UC accommodation, which is deadline 10 June. So is there any backing fees at UCL accommodation right now? Because I heard from UCL website, UPC students and foundation course students will proceed application like. So I heard that it is difficult for UCL undergraduate students to apply UCL accommodation, but UPC student is easy to proceed. Application of UCL accommodation. So is there any vacancies UCL accommodation right now.
Speaker B: Currently, like if you want to like book this accommodation, you have to pay the holding fee and then once you get your caf and visa then you can proceed ahead with it. So is it okay if I reach out to you on email or WhatsApp to answer all your queries?
Speaker A: So I have to send my inquiries via WhatsApp?
Speaker B: No, no, yeah, that would be easier for us so that we can answer you more appropriately. So Is this your WhatsApp number? 803-17-56138.
Speaker A: So could you say that? So I will note your WhatsApp code.
Speaker B: Okay, you want to know my WhatsApp number?
Speaker A: Yeah.
Speaker B: Okay, just give me a moment. Okay, so My number is +4.4. Yeah, four four, seven double four, seven double four.
Speaker A: Okay. 616-198-39837171. So 447446. Is it correct?
Speaker B: Yes. Yes, perfect.
Speaker A: Okay, so could you teach me your name please?
Speaker B: My name is Anuranan. A N U R A N E N. You can just save my number as Amber student. That would be much easier for you.
Speaker A: A n. Are you, are you okay?
Speaker B: Nne.
Speaker A: Okay.
Speaker B: A n u r a n a n.
Speaker A: E n.
Speaker B: Yes, yes, thank you.
Speaker A: And so for now, is there any Japanese staff now?
Speaker B: No, we don't have. We have, we have English speaking stuff and we have Chinese speaking stuff currently.
Speaker A: Okay. Sir, sorry, I'm. I have a poor English skill. So. Yeah, that's, that's fine.
Speaker B: So yeah, you can reach out to us on WhatsApp, it will be easier for you and us to communicate easily. Yes.
Speaker A: Yeah. I really appreciate your kindness. Thank you.
Speaker B: Thank you so much. Bye. Bye.
Speaker A: Yeah, goodbye.

Speaker A: 今、 電話 に 出る.
